quizzes.title: React Native Basics
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of React Native fundamentals

questions.questionText: What is React Native?
options: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A framework for building native mobile apps using React
questions.explanation: React Native is a framework that allows you to build native mobile applications using React and JavaScript.

questions.questionText: Which command is used to create a new React Native project?
questions.explanation: npx react-native init is the standard command to create a new React Native project.

questions.questionText: What is the basic building block of a React Native UI?
questions.explanation: Components are the basic building blocks of React Native UI. They can be functional or class-based.

questions.questionText: Which component is used to create a scrollable list in React Native?
questions.explanation: FlatList is the recommended component for creating scrollable lists in React Native as it has better performance than ScrollView.

questions.questionText: What is a Component in React Native?
options: A reusable piece of UI code
questions.explanation: A Component is a reusable piece of UI code that can be composed to build complex user interfaces.

questions.questionText: What is JSX in React Native?
questions.explanation: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that lets you write HTML-like code in your JavaScript files.

questions.questionText: What is Props in React Native?
options: A way to pass data between components
questions.explanation: Props (Properties) are a way to pass data from parent to child components in React Native.

questions.questionText: What is State in React Native?
options: A way to manage component data
questions.explanation: State is a way to manage data that can change over time within a component.

questions.questionText: What is a Hook in React Native?
options: A way to use state and other React features
questions.explanation: Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components.

questions.questionText: What is useEffect in React Native?
options: A hook for handling side effects
questions.explanation: useEffect is a hook that lets you perform side effects in functional components, such as data fetching or subscriptions.

questions.questionText: What is a Component in React Native?
options: A reusable piece of UI code
questions.explanation: A Component is a reusable piece of UI code that can be composed to build complex user interfaces.

questions.questionText: What is JSX in React Native?
questions.explanation: JSX is a syntax extension for JavaScript that allows you to write HTML-like code in your JavaScript files.

questions.questionText: What is Props in React Native?
options: A way to pass data between components
questions.explanation: Props are a way to pass data from parent to child components, making components reusable and configurable.

questions.questionText: What is State in React Native?
options: A way to manage component data
questions.explanation: State is a way to manage component data that can change over time, triggering re-renders when updated.

questions.questionText: What is a Hook in React Native?
options: A way to use state and other React features
questions.explanation: Hooks are functions that let you use state and other React features in functional components.

questions.questionText: What is useEffect in React Native?
options: A hook for handling side effects
questions.explanation: useEffect is a hook for handling side effects in functional components, like data fetching or subscriptions.

quizzes.title: React Native Intermediate
quizzes.description: Intermediate concepts in React Native development

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Navigation?
questions.explanation: React Navigation is a library that provides navigation capabilities to React Native apps.

questions.questionText: Which hook is used to manage state in functional components?
questions.explanation: useState is a React Hook that lets you add state to functional components.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of AsyncStorage in React Native?
questions.explanation: AsyncStorage is a simple, asynchronous, persistent, key-value storage system for React Native.

questions.questionText: Which library is commonly used for handling forms in React Native?
questions.explanation: All of these libraries (Redux Form, Formik, React Hook Form) are commonly used for form handling in React Native.

questions.questionText: What is Redux in React Native?
questions.explanation: Redux is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps, commonly used for state management in React Native.

questions.questionText: What is React Navigation in React Native?
questions.explanation: React Navigation is a library that provides navigation capabilities for React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is AsyncStorage in React Native?
options: A storage system for persistent data
questions.explanation: AsyncStorage is a simple, asynchronous, persistent, key-value storage system for React Native.

questions.questionText: What is Axios in React Native?
options: A HTTP client for making requests
questions.explanation: Axios is a promise-based HTTP client for making requests in React Native applications.

questions.questionText: What is React Native CLI?
options: A command-line interface for React Native
questions.explanation: React Native CLI is a command-line interface for creating and managing React Native projects.

questions.questionText: What is Metro in React Native?
questions.explanation: Metro is the JavaScript bundler that comes with React Native, responsible for bundling your JavaScript code.

questions.questionText: What is Redux in React Native?
questions.explanation: Redux is a state management library that helps manage application state in a predictable way.

questions.questionText: What is React Navigation in React Native?
questions.explanation: React Navigation is a library for handling navigation between screens in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is AsyncStorage in React Native?
questions.explanation: AsyncStorage is a persistent storage system for storing data locally on the device.

questions.questionText: What is Axios in React Native?
questions.explanation: Axios is a HTTP client library for making network requests in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native CLI?
options: A command-line tool for React Native
questions.explanation: React Native CLI is a command-line tool for creating and managing React Native projects.

questions.questionText: What is Metro in React Native?
questions.explanation: Metro is a JavaScript bundler for React Native that helps bundle and serve your app's code.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Debugger?
questions.explanation: React Native Debugger is a tool for debugging React Native apps, including Redux and network inspection.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Gesture Handler?
questions.explanation: React Native Gesture Handler is a library for handling gestures in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Reanimated?
questions.explanation: React Native Reanimated is a library for creating smooth animations in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Vector Icons?
questions.explanation: React Native Vector Icons is a library for using vector icons in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Paper?
questions.explanation: React Native Paper is a UI component library that implements Material Design for React Native.

quizzes.title: React Native Advanced
quizzes.description: Advanced React Native concepts and best practices

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's Hermes engine?
options: To improve app performance and reduce memory usage
questions.explanation: Hermes is a JavaScript engine optimized for React Native that improves app performance and reduces memory usage.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's TurboModules?
options: To improve performance of native modules
questions.explanation: TurboModules is a new architecture for native modules in React Native that improves performance and type safety.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's Fabric?
questions.explanation: Fabric is React Native's new rendering system that improves UI performance and enables better integration with native platforms.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of React Native's CodePush?
options: To push code changes to users without app store updates
questions.explanation: CodePush allows you to push updates to your React Native app without going through the app store review process.

questions.questionText: What is Hermes in React Native?
questions.explanation: Hermes is a JavaScript engine optimized for React Native, improving app performance and reducing memory usage.

questions.questionText: What is CodePush in React Native?
options: A service for updating apps over the air
questions.explanation: CodePush is a service that allows you to push updates to your React Native apps without going through the app store review process.

questions.questionText: What is Flipper in React Native?
options: A platform for debugging mobile apps
questions.explanation: Flipper is a platform for debugging mobile apps, providing tools for inspecting and debugging React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Reanimated?
options: A library for creating smooth animations
questions.explanation: React Native Reanimated is a library that provides a more powerful way to create smooth animations in React Native.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Gesture Handler?
questions.explanation: React Native Gesture Handler is a library that provides native-driven gesture management for React Native.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Fabric?
options: A new architecture for React Native
questions.explanation: React Native Fabric is a new architecture that improves the performance and reliability of React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is Hermes in React Native?
questions.explanation: Hermes is a JavaScript engine optimized for React Native, improving app performance and reducing memory usage.

questions.questionText: What is CodePush in React Native?
questions.explanation: CodePush is a service that allows you to update React Native apps without going through the app store.

questions.questionText: What is Flipper in React Native?
questions.explanation: Flipper is a debugging tool for React Native apps, providing a platform for debugging mobile apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Fabric?
options: A new architecture for React Native
questions.explanation: React Native Fabric is a new architecture that improves performance and reliability of React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native TurboModules?
options: A system for native module communication
questions.explanation: TurboModules is a system for improving the communication between JavaScript and native modules.

questions.questionText: What is React Native JSI?
questions.explanation: JSI (JavaScript Interface) is a system for direct communication between JavaScript and native code.

questions.questionText: What is React Native New Architecture?
options: A new architecture for React Native
questions.explanation: React Native New Architecture is a set of improvements to React Native's core architecture.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Performance Monitor?
questions.explanation: React Native Performance Monitor is a tool for monitoring and improving app performance.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Memory Profiler?
questions.explanation: React Native Memory Profiler is a tool for identifying and fixing memory leaks in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Network Inspector?
questions.explanation: React Native Network Inspector is a tool for debugging network requests in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Layout Inspector?
questions.explanation: React Native Layout Inspector is a tool for debugging and optimizing layouts in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Component Profiler?
questions.explanation: React Native Component Profiler is a tool for analyzing component performance and rendering.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Bridge?
options: A communication system between JS and native
questions.explanation: React Native Bridge is a system for communication between JavaScript and native code.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Thread Model?
questions.explanation: React Native Thread Model is a model for handling different threads in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native Turbo?
questions.explanation: React Native Turbo is a system for optimizing performance in React Native apps.

questions.questionText: What is React Native New Architecture Migration?
options: A process for upgrading to new architecture
questions.explanation: React Native New Architecture Migration is a process for upgrading apps to the new React Native architecture.
